Class GoodDay

java.lang.Object
src.GoodDay
public class GoodDay extends Object
GoodDay.java Author: Chris Silva Assignment: Module 5 - Good Day Evaluator Description: This program represents a conditional evaluator which determines the state of ones day, given a number of factors.

    • GoodDay

      public GoodDay(int temperature, double humidity, boolean isWorkoutDone, String workout, boolean isHomeworkDone, String dinnerMeal)
      Parameterized constructor which accepts values for all fields. Initializes values for all parameters.
      Parameters:
      temperature - the current temperature
      humidity - the current humidity
      isWorkoutDone - whether a workout has been completed
      workout - the workout that is completed
      isHomeworkDone - whether all homework has been completed
      dinnerMeal - a dinner meal to be had

    • isWeatherGood

      public boolean isWeatherGood()
      Determines whether the current weather conditions are considered good, with humidity being less than 50% and temperatures from 60 and up to 85 being used to define "good" weather.
      Returns:
      true if humidity invalid input: '<' 50% and temperature is 60-85 degrees, false otherwise

    • toString

      public String toString()
      Returns a formatted string representing the GoodDay object. Includes all relevant factors: temperature, humidity, workout and homework completion status, as well as dinner plans.
      Overrides:
      toString in class Object
      Returns:
      a multi-line string displaying all fields of the GoodDay object with descriptive labels

    • workoutCompleted

      public boolean workoutCompleted()
      Determines if a valid workout has been completed. A workout is considered valid if it is one of two permissible values: "Strength training" or "Cardio".
      Returns:
      true if a valid workout (Strength training or Cardio) has been completed, false if workout is null or not one of the permissible workouts

    • scoreCount

      public int scoreCount()
      Calculates a "score" for the day which is used in determining if a day is good. The score is incremented with each subsequent condition that is met. Base points are awarded for good weather, a valid workout, completed homework, and a planned dinner. Bonus points are awarded for "perfect" weather (temperature 70-75 degrees and humidity less than 50.0%), and both a workout and homework having been completed.
      Returns:
      an integer value used to keep the "score" of the day's completed tasks, ranging from 0 to 6

    • getDayScore

      public String getDayScore()
      Calculates and formats the score of the current day as a fraction. The score is based off the number of relevant factors which have been met. (good weather, completed homework and workout, planned dinner)
      Returns:
      a String message displaying the current score out of the max possible score of 4, formatted as "score/maxScore"

    • resetDay

      public void resetDay()
      Resets the day's values. A day is considered reset when all relevant conditions are false or null, and numeric fields set to zero.

    • isTodayGood

      public String isTodayGood()
      Evaluates whether today is a good day based on multiple factors. Requirements: Good weather conditions, completed homework and workout, along with a selected dinner meal.
      Returns:
      a String message indicating whether today is a good day containing details on relevant factors, or a message of encouragement if the conditions are not met
